title: Humanist sans-serif
content:
Anyone know what this font is? It's a bit like a rounded space-age Optima of some sorts.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [lagkagehuset.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803140100/http:/typophile.com/files/lagkagehuset.jpg) | 30.97 KB |
author: JulianHansen

comments.content: Oblik Classic comes very close (the Gs don't match and some of the letters aren't as rounded as your sample), but not quite. Check it out on myfonts.com
Looks like a custom job based on an all-lowercase [Peignot](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803140100/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/peignot), also by Adolphe Mouron Cassandre, the author of Optima.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140803140100im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PeignotDemiModified_4826.jpg)
  
Here are your letters in the lower case of Peignot Demi -- a font designed in 1937 by A.M. Cassandre with Charles Peignot for Deberny & Peignot -- with the ascenders on l, k and h clipped to the x height; the base stroke on the l extended to match the base stroke on the e; the spur on the g raised to the baseline; and all letters widened 120%.  
Cassandre's "space age" design would do the job.  
Don

Took quite a while to fight with the server to make my post.  
Then I finally got two for the price of one.  
this duplicate should not exist.  
Don
